title: Free Market Capitalist
author: Free Market Capitalist
content: Trump’s Bitcoin Transaction Makes History at NYC Crypto Bar – Will This Sway Voters? I put it in quotation marks because he doesn't make it, it has to be made for him. Although it may have significant symbolism, a former US president and presidential candidate using bitcoin to buy some hamburgers, which he then handed out.He is clearly trying to win the vote of bitcoiners but he could learn a bit more about it by now.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: One small step for Donald, one yuuge step for mankind.Soon enough he will be debating against big blockers, supporting decentralization too. We all used to be newbies once.The next US administration will be tha bomb once he gets elected.Elon will take us to the moon with his ships and Donald will take bitcoin to the moon with his support for crypto.We will really go to the moon this time and it won’t be a Hollywood production.

comments.body: Yeah this is the first Donald Trump's aide uses Bitcoin to buy a burger at a bar in New York.As we can see Trump didn't even able to use phone and scan QR code using Bitcoin wallet, he really know what Bitcoin is!Too bad the aide didn't get any spotlight even though he was struggle to pay using Bitcoin, I don't even know who's him after made some research.

It was Trump who authorized his aides to do the transactions on his behalf, so it was him. Aides can act for government officials if they get approval. Most of the actions most presidents take and done by members of staff.

comments.author: Sonia_123
comments.body: Donald Trump has used Bitcoin to buy hamburgers at a Bitcoin bar and restaurant, which is popular in accepting Bitcoin at pubkey in New York City, hosted the former US President and 2024 Republican nominee for a campaign stop on Sept. 18. This act has now made him the first ex-US president to use cryptocurrency in a transaction .https://cointelegraph.com/news/donald-trump-bitcoin-transaction-burger-nyc-bar

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Trump didn't make any transaction with Bitcoin from the video I watched on FOX news. In fact he didn't look interested in it. He looked more interested in speaking to the "people at the other side" like he said after the dude in a face cap triumphantly announced that  Trump was the first presidential candidate to make such transaction thereby making history. For the record I am indifferent to whoever wins. I'll leave that for the Americans to decide. Right now smart electorates will look at the policies of the presidential aspirants and make cast their votes on whichever one they feel appeals more to them.

comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on September 19, 2024, 06:02:12 AMTrump didn't make any transaction with Bitcoin from the video I watched on FOX news. In fact he didn't look interested in it. He looked more interested in speaking to the "people at the other side" like he said after the dude in a face cap triumphantly announced that  Trump was the first presidential candidate to make such transaction thereby making history. For the record I am indifferent to whoever wins. I'll leave that for the Americans to decide. Right now smart electorates will look at the policies of the presidential aspirants and make cast their votes on whichever one they feel appeals more to them.Basically, Trump is the first US president to make a successful bitcoin payment, yet it'll be appalling if bitcoiners are forcing the whole process down his throat. From your response, the president may just be doing all this because he wants the community to vote for him. I'm 90% sure he wouldn't do all that when he climbs to the throne as president of America. For now, he's like any other investor showing out his excitement for bitcoin, could it be that the memory he's creating with bitcoiners would make impact to his behavior as a leader of America, we may not have been hearing him talk repeatedly about weapons and security in America. Trump's Agenda is to make America great again, he rarely talks about bitcoin in his campaigns. The last time I watched him speak, it was all revolving around war, nuclear weapon, military, etc. However, should bitcoin be on his agenda, it's the least of what he's thinking about.

comments.author: BlockExplorer24
comments.body: "Trump using Bitcoin to buy hamburgers feels like a marketing stunt, right? While the symbolism is interesting, it's clear that he's trying to connect with Bitcoiners. But let's be real, it's not Trump who's doing the heavy lifting on the transaction. It makes for good headlines but maybe not the most authentic connection to the crypto community!"

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: I guess phrase "Better late than never" applies in this case. While i agree that it's his attempt to get more votes, at least it lets general public know that Bitcoin can used to pay goods and services.

Everything he or Harris does in their campaign has no other purpose than to win more votes. Why do we only target and criticize him?Yes, he is doing this for more votes and those who are supporting him are doing it for their own benefit. Likewise, those who vote for Harris expect to benefit from her policies. And as you said: he can also learn and gain a little more knowledge about bitcoin, which is actually beneficial for both him and bitcoin since it has caught the attention of a presidential candidate. Meanwhile, Harris continues to ignore everything about bitcoin and as a bitcoin investor that makes me even more worried if she wins.Given what is going on, it is clear that Trump will bring more good than Harris when it comes to crypto.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: I like that he is putting some efforts into it. He got someone to tell him more about Bitcoin and how he can actually make use of technology in a day to day life. With this, many boomers who were not aware of how Bitcoin is different than Gold, will be able to understand that you can use Bitcoin for quick payments as well. This might be funny for you all who are already using Bitcoin from ages but it's interesting for the older generation.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: It is funny, but since he is a personality, some things are really just made ready for him, and go with it. Showing that he tried it is somewhat a win for crypto since it will be exposed and seen by people who might not be exposed to it. At least it's something. I always remember that he wasn't open to the cryptocurrency space before and have made some comments. It's never too late I guess.
